timeline.message:

- Update API design.

- Add unit tests.

XRDDEV-903 API for querying ocsp responder diagnostics

- Implement API for querying ocsp responder diagnostics.
- Update API design.

XRDDEV-903 Refactor diagnostics status code

- Remove shared diagnostics status codes and their mapping.
- Implement global conf, timestamping and ocsp specific status codes and their mapping.

- Update tests.

- Update API design.
- Update tests.
XRDDEV-903 Minor fixes to API design

timeline.bodyText: Not a big deal but aligning constructor parameters seems to be fine by CheckStyle but to be more consistent with the majority of the codebase maybe using an 8 space continuation instead would make sense?
timeline.author: carohauta

timeline.bodyText:
Could the http request be simplified by using the RestTemplate class that Spring offers? I think most of the manual deserializing and json parsing in this service class could be avoided with it since it should be able to map a response directly into the given MyArbitraryObject.class
Also could be good to ensure that there is some sort of timeout for the request.
timeline.author: carohauta

replies.bodyText:
Adding a timeout is a good idea. 👍
I tried using RestTemplate, but in this case it does not actually simplify the implementation that much if at all. One reason for that is that the Security Server admin components return the diagnostics response using application/octet-stream content-type. HttpMessageConverter does not support that content-type and processing fails with an exception.
ERROR o.n.x.r.e.ApplicationExceptionHandler - exception caught
org.niis.xroad.restapi.exceptions.DeviationAwareRuntimeException: org.springframework.web.client.RestClientException: Could not extract response: no suitable HttpMessageConverter found for response type [class ee.ria.xroad.common.DiagnosticsStatus] and content type [application/octet-stream]

This can be fixed by writing a custom HttpMessageConverter, but it would probably just mean moving the current parsing logic to another class. Eventually, it would not make the implementation much simpler compared to the current approach.
replies.author: petkivim

replies.bodyText: Maybe moving the logic to it's own class wouldn't be so bad 🤔 But I think this is good now since the parsing is only needed in this service.
replies.author: carohauta

timeline.bodyText: Could the URLs maybe be placed in application properties? Something like this?

timeline.bodyText: This test class does not seem to depend on Spring so removing these annotations will speed up this test a lot.

replies.bodyText: The date/time conversions were a bit tricky since the source data uses LocalTime that does not contain date information. Therefore, better to test them thoroughly. :)
replies.author: petkivim
